metadata.title: Guide to Analyzing and Reporting Group-Informed Consensus in Pol.is Conversations
metadata.purpose: Generate consistent, evidence-based reports identifying and explaining areas of consensus across different groups

criticalInstructions.instruction: Generate a JSON response that conforms to the provided schema. DO NOT INCLUDE ANY OTHER TEXT.
DO NOT return ```json at the beginning of the response. This is not markdown. Do not end the response with ```, your response MUST begin with { and end with }

term.name: group_informed_consensus
term.description: Comments with high agreement across all or most groups, despite differences on other topics
term.threshold: Variable based on number of groups (0.7 for 2 groups, 0.47 for 3 groups, 0.32 for 4 groups, 0.24 for 5+ groups)

term.name: strong_consensus
term.description: Comments with exceptionally high agreement across all groups

criticalInstructions.instruction: Focus on identifying meaningful patterns of consensus, not just listing individual comments with high agreement. What themes emerge from points of agreement?
Consider the significance of consensus in the context of group divisions elsewhere. Common ground is most meaningful when groups otherwise disagree.
Evaluate the strength and breadth of consensus. Is it widespread or limited to specific topics?

paragraph.format:
Analysis of voting patterns revealed [level_of_consensus] across different participant groups, with [number_of_comments] comments showing strong agreement that transcended group divisions. These areas of consensus were [distribution_pattern] across the conversation, [concentration_pattern]. [Additional_high_level_context].
The strongest areas of cross-group agreement centered on [primary_consensus_topic], with several statements receiving consistently high agreement from all groups. These comments shared common features, including [shared_feature_1] and [shared_feature_2], suggesting that [interpretation_of_consensus_foundation]. [Additional_insight_if_relevant].
Other significant areas of consensus included [secondary_consensus_topic], particularly statements that [feature_of_consensus_statements]. This pattern suggests that despite their differences on [divisive_topic], participants from all groups shared [common_value_or_priority] when considering [secondary_consensus_topic].

paragraphInstructions.instruction: Provide a comprehensive overview that: - Quantifies the overall level of cross-group consensus - Identifies main areas/topics generating consensus - Analyzes patterns in consensus comments - Proposes shared values or priorities underlying agreement - Supports all claims with appropriate citations

criticalInstructions.instruction: Analyze what consensus areas reveal about shared values or priorities across groups, even when they disagree on other topics.
Consider how consensus areas might serve as bridges between otherwise divided groups. What starting points for dialogue emerge?
Balance optimism about consensus with realistic assessment of its limits. Not all consensus indicates deep agreement on underlying values.

paragraph.format:
The consensus areas identified in this conversation reveal important shared values across participant groups, despite their differences on other topics. Most notably, the widespread agreement on [primary_consensus_topic] suggests that [shared_value_interpretation], even among groups that disagree sharply on [divisive_topic]. This shared commitment to [common_value] was particularly evident in [specific_example_with_citation].
Another important area of common ground emerged around [secondary_consensus_topic], where agreement across groups indicated shared [another_common_value]. Despite differing approaches to [related_divisive_topic], participants from all groups expressed support for [specific_position], as seen in [another_specific_example]. This suggests that disagreements may stem more from [interpretation_of_disagreement_source] than from fundamental value differences.
These consensus areas potentially offer valuable starting points for bridge-building between otherwise divided groups. The shared commitment to [key_shared_value] could serve as foundation for dialogue about more contentious issues like [divisive_topic], by establishing common ground before addressing points of disagreement. Similarly, the broad agreement on [practical_consensus_area] suggests potential for collaborative approaches to [practical_application].

paragraphInstructions.instruction: For each identified pattern of consensus: - Identify the underlying shared values or priorities - Connect to broader conversation themes, especially areas of division - Consider practical implications or applications - Support all interpretations with specific examples and citations - Maintain balanced perspective on consensus significance

paragraph.length: 3-5 paragraphs, depending on extent and complexity of consensus patterns

case.description: Agreement on a statement that seems to contradict a pattern of division

validationRules.rule: All claims about consensus must be based on agreement data across groups
Each claim requires at least one citation
Multiple consensus areas must be identified and analyzed
